result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Receipted at SSD 10-24-2022
22R 019628
Status conference on November 10, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

4:31 PM Defendant Steven Sebastian Weiss appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Zachary Derksen appeared by video for Steven Sebastian Weiss.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Def was not able to go to Samaritan hand so is still in custody until finding an alternate placement. Atty Derksen submitted an application to treatment court, State advises no decision yet to this application to Drug Court. State requests 30 day adjournment.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
From Court to Attorney Derksen RE: Defendant - application for Drug Court
Instructions on How to Appear Remotely by Zoom for the week of October 3, 2022
To Drug Court from Defendant RE: Application/participation in Drug Court
Email communication from Atty Derksen re; finding inpatient treatment for Mr. Weiss
from Mr. Weiss requesting $5,000 signature bond

1:35 PM Defendant Steven Sebastian Weiss appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Zachary Derksen appeared by video for Steven Sebastian Weiss.  Attorney Grant D Scaife in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Derksen - Deft contact Samaritan's Hands and there is a spot for him for treatment on Aug 9th. Defense requesting signature bond or cash bond not exceeding $250.00 to allow Deft to attend treatment starting next week.
State requests verification.
Court will require rules for Samaritan's Hands and Atty Derksen to fill out Addendum to Bond.
State will not object to modification if Deft is able to attend treatment.
Court will grant request to convert to signature bond of $3000.00 with same conditions contingent on supplement to bond and obtaining rules for Samaritan's Hands. Bond will remain as is now and Judge will work with Clerk's Office once all information is obtained to create an amended bond for signature.
Court sets a date in the future.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 04:30 pm.

to modify bail - defense

to be signed and posted by 3:30pm today or warrant will be issued
Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia.

Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription.

8:22 AM Prosecuting attorney Adam T. Stuart in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven Sebastian Weiss appeared by phone.  Attorney Zachary Derksen appeared by video for Steven Sebastian Weiss. 
Atty Derksen needs more time - has not received Discovery yet.
Court reschedules non-standard Motion deadline to August 8th.
Court notes positive Day Report for Meth on June 8th.
Atty Derksen not disputing positive test.
State requesting Court to forfeit $1000.00 cash on deposit and notes caselaw. Requesting $2500.00 cash bond.
Court orders $1000.00 cash bond forfeited.
Court orders new bond amount to be $1750.00 with same conditions as previous bond - to be signed and posted by 3:30pm today or warrant will be issued.
